intro: Macrocarpaea angelliae, commonly known as the Angell's macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny leaves and yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
